dialogues.text: AS MUSIC CONTINUES.  Annie waves as Becky gets into her  car and rides away.  Annie turns to her doorway and  stops.  She can't go back in.  She needs to walk and  think.  She crosses the street into a little  neighborhood park.  We can see the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes out onto the porch.  Flops down in his deck  chair.  The city lights in the background.  Same moon.   The MUSIC CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie flops down on a child's swing set in the park.   MUSIC CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE IN THE SWING
dialogues.text: As Walter pulls up into the parking space Becky pulled  out of.  Annie starts toward him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM ON THE BACK OF THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Make my bed and light the lights I'll arrive late  tonight, blackbird, bye bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie on the phone at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie, it's Annie.  Fine, I'm  fine.  Listen, I'm doing an  article on call-in radio shows.   Do you know anyone who works  for someone named Dr. Marcia  Fieldstone...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a writer for the Baltimore  Sun and I'm a friend of Laurie  Johnson's.  I'm doing a piece  on how people handle  bereavement and I understand  that you had a caller the other  night... I know you're not  supposed to, but Laurie said  you might, and I'll plug the  show and everything -- (she winces in  anticipation of a  rejection, but then  her face relaxes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie dialing Sam's telephone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jonah Baldwin, we're  not in right now but you can  leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baldwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie at her computer modem.  She's dialing a number.   We hear some beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directory.  Enter password. (Annie types) Ann Reed.  BSun124. (computer) Find. (Annie types) Samuel Baldwin. (computer types) 216 Samuel Baldwin.  Strike Y  to printout or enter factors. (Annie types) Samuel Baldwin, Seattle. (there's a pause) Not found. (Annie thinks for a  moment, then types) Samuel Baldwin, Jonah Baldwin. (a pause) Samuel Baldwin, Jonah Baldwin  found.  Strike Y to printout or  enter factors. (Annie types Y)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now on the computer screen, we see a funeral notice  from the Chicago Tribune that reads: Baldwin, Margaret  Abbott, beloved wife of Samuel, mother of Jonah, June  10, Funeral 10 a.m.  Thursday, Church of the Heavenly  Rest, 110 N.  State, in lieu of flowers contributions  should be sent to Chicago Horticultural Society.  And  then there's a citation: Chicago Tribune, June 12, 1989. Annie types another entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (typing) Samuel.  Baldwin, Chicago. (after a beat) Four Samuel Baldwins.  Strike Y  to printout. (Annie strikes Y) Samuel Baldwin, arrested for  grand larceny, 1961.  Samuel  Baldwin, alderman, convicted of  accepting bribes, 1967.  Samuel  J. Baldwin, architect, built  City Plaza. (Annie presses Y)

dialogues.speaker: A PRINTOUT OF AN ARTICLE
dialogues.text: that Annie's reading.  There's a newspaper picture of  Sam at the dedication of a building site.  It's got that  kind of grainy quality that things have when they've  been transmitted, but you can make out Sam's basic good  looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie coming from the street toward a storefront in  downtown Baltimore across the street from the courthouse. Next door there's a bailbondsman, there are ambulance- chasing lawyers hanging out on the corner. The sign on the door reads: "No job too small." "All  major credit cards accepted." And then everything on  the sign is translated into Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Bo Wheedle, a former cop, sits at his desk  listening to Annie.  He has some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know about him  because... he's involved with  my sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a pattern of getting  involved with losers... Once  she almost ran away with a  human cannonball from the  circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want a matrimonial, past  wives, any kids--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know that part --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want a financial, is he  a deadbeat, we can do a D&B --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, it's more like, who  is he, does he have a sense of  humor, is he nice -- no forget  nice, I've got nice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you the truth, I  heard this guy on a call-in  radio show and I might not  marry the person I should marry  because I've become obsessed  with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Like Glenn Close in that  movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not remotely.  I just want  to find out about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a tail. (picking up the phone) I got a guy in Seattle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah is watching Geraldo with his babysitter, CLARISE,  17. Geraldo is talking to a heavily made-up, sexily-dressed  WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long have you been a  woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (husky voice) About two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is coming down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jonah) Pssst!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah hits the remote control and the channel changes to  the Disney channel as Sam comes into the room, dressed  for his date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarise, I'll be back by  midnight I'm sure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tosses Jonah a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from the  envelope) Sleepless and Son. (reading the postmark) Baltimore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to open the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left the number of the  restaurant I'll be at if  there's any emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jonah) How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks in mirror) I look stupid.  I look stupid,  don't I? I look like I'm  trying too hard.  I was going  to get a haircut but then I  thought I'd look like I just  got a haircut. (checks his teeth,  peers up his nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the letters) This is a good letter, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his fly, looks  down at his feet) The heels on these shoes are  very large.  Why have I never  noticed this? The heels on  these shoes are grotesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name is Annie.  Annie Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm late.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Jonah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this one part, okay? (reading) "I have been an excellent  third-baseman for as long as I  or anyone else can remember,  and I guarantee you will not  get one past me"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah, I'm leaving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAIT!!! (Sam stops, amazed at  Jonah's vehemence;  Jonah continues  reading) -- "and while we're on the  subject, let's just say right  now that Brooks Robinson was  the best third baseman ever.   It's important that you agree  with me on that because I'm  from Baltimore."  Dad, she  thinks Brooks Robinson is the  greatest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam goes out the door with Jonah behind him, waving the  letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone thinks Brooks Robinson  is the greatest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops, takes Jonah by the hand and takes him back  into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.  I want to show you  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam pulls down the map of the United States, which is  hanging over one of the kitchen windows and stands Jonah  in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is Seattle. (moves his finger  across the country) And here is Baltimore.  Case  closed. (he pulls the map and  it snaps back up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want us to go to  Baltimore.  She wants to meet  us in New York City on  Valentine's Day.  On top of the  Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.  We'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam goes out the door.  Jonah just looks down at his  letter, his hopes on hold.  Clarise switches the TV back  to Geraldo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits at a table.  Nursing a beer.  A little nervous. He looks up and spots:

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: walking into the place.  She's attractive.  She waves  and smiles and sits down, orders a white wine spritzer  from the maitre d'. After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were never going  to call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really wanted you to call me,  and I thought you were never  going to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have called me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  No way I was going to  be the first woman you went out  with after... (she gestures  helplessly) There is no percentage  whatsoever in being the first  woman anyone goes out with  after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the first woman I'm  going out with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whatdya say? I'll get the  check, and I'll call you in  eight months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria laughs far too enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you are funny --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a CLICK as the image FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: SEATTLE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: sitting at a table across the room, having just taken  the picture of Sam we saw frozen, with a miniature  camera.  In QUICK CUTS we see a progression of later  photographs: SAM AND VICTORIA SIMPLY TALKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots and lots of fish stalls with crabs, etc.  Annie is  walking with Det. Wheedle toward a table you stand at  near the clam bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me he's living in squalor.   Tell me everything he has is  being repossessed, including  his filthy, dented mobile home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a houseboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boats.  You go out in them.   You come back in them.  I hate  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houseboats don't go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boats.  All anyone talks about  is the wind.  Is it up, is it  down.  I can't live with a man  who only talks about the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a boat boat.  It's  really a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the lake right in the  middle of Seattle. (beat) It rains nine months of the  year in Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I don't have to pay for  that piece of information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's free.  He's an  architect.  Used to do big  high-profile projects.  He  scaled it all back when his  wife died.  Now he remodels  people's homes.  He works in  a small firm, makes a good  living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows her a good picture of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the next shot.  Sees a picture of Sam and  Victoria in the restaurant, although all we see of  Victoria is her back and mane of blond hair. Hold on Annie's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With its stalls of king crab, but otherwise almost  identical in design to the Baltimore marketplace. Sam and Jonah walk past the fish stand, Sam looking  around, slightly distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure we could go to New  York, catch the Knicks, and  since we'd be there anyway,  obviously we'd go to the Empire  State Building --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Victoria comes toward them, with a bag full of  groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she bringing that bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to cook something  for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sam.  And let me guess --  you must be Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (back to the subject) He should book now because we  can get an excursion fare.   Jessica's parents are travel  agents and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Jonah and Victoria are at the dining room table,  finishing the dinner that Victoria cooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't finish the job.  She's  on her sixth painter, now she's  thinking maybe she wants the  fireplace rebricked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know her pretty well.  Maybe  I could call her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already solved it.  I've  hired a hit man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria laughs a little too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that is so funny, you are so  funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiles.  Jonah is appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time she wants to change  something, she talks in this  little baby voice -- (in a little baby  voice) "Couldn't you just move the  stairway a teeny tiny bit?"--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria almost dies laughing.  Jonah's eyes narrow to  slits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.  In fact, my firm has  box seats for the Mariners.   Why don't we all go next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about camping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went camping once. (to Sam) I love to brush my teeth in a  brook and floss with a weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ought to start camping  again, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, tiger.  Time for bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only ten o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little edgy) Jonah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank Victoria for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for dinner.  I never saw  anybody cook potatoes that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gracious) I'm glad you liked it.  Good  night, Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch as Jonah pads down the hallway. EXT. SAM'S HOUSEBOAT - REAR DECK - ON SAM & VICTORIA They're standing at the rail, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah has snuck downstairs and is peeking out the window  at them. Victoria runs her finger down Sam's arm. Jonah is horrified. He dashes over to the phone and begins to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleeping Annie and Walter are startled awake by the  ringing of her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through filter) Turn on your radio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through filter) The kid is on.  You've got me  listening to this garbage.   Go on, turn it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's just Becky, she's  having trouble with Rich again. (into phone) Hold on, Becky, I'm going  downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the phone on hold and gets out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Annie comes in and turns on the radio and picks up  the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a complete disaster.  I  wanted him to find a wife, but  he's got the wrong one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I going to explain this  to Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, listen to this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie takes the portable radio and the telephone  receiver, opens the broom closet and closes herself  inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't your father be the  judge of whether she's right  or wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ON JONAH
dialogues.text: sneaking glances out at Sam and Victoria as he talks.   Victoria puts her arms around Sam's waist and clasps  them behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please don't make me  sick.  He's not sane enough to  judge anything.  She's a ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled slightly) My dad's been captured by a ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Sam happens to look over to the window.  Jonah  ducks down behind the desk before Sam sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria notices Sam glancing back at the house, aware  that he's concerned about Jonah seeing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back) No. (beat) After he was born, every time  we started to make love, he  would cry.  He had an uncanny  sense of timing.  We really  shouldn't do anything here  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she moves in to kiss him.

dialogues.speaker: ON JONAH
dialogues.text: Jonah peeks up over the top of the desk to check if the  coast is clear and is sickened to see them locked in a  kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, it's major.  He's  kissing her on the lips.  I  have to stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Come on, Jonah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah, you can't butt in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the phone and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: SHE SCREAMS.
dialogues.text: It's Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Scarlett.  In the broom  closet.  With the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Becky) I gotta go.  I'll see you at  work. (she hangs up, turns  off radio) Walter, you scared me.  Don't  ever do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam holds Jonah by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I saw a black widow  spider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at Victoria, shrugs.  Back to Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bathroom upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water tastes better in the  kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true.  Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she and Walter go upstairs to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky heard this woman on the  radio complaining about this  guy she was sure was Rick,  which meant he was cheating on  her.  She was completely  hysterical.  Then it turned out  the woman lived in Duluth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  It makes no sense at  all.  Thank God my life is in  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter asleep.  Annie stares up at the ceiling, wide  awake.  Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah lying on his pillow, staring up at the ceiling,  wide awake.  Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is reading the letter from Annie.  She's sitting  at a computer in their travel agency, which is on the  entrance level to a charming Seattle townhouse.  Jonah  sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Y. O. H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) Yeah. (a beat) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your only hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, at her computer, talking to Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I would look into  doing a story about those radio  shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; after a beat) You'd probably have to go  somewhere to really look into  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah and Jessica at the mailbox.  As Jonah opens the  mailbox and drops the letter in, we hear a SQUEAL OF  BRAKES.  It's Sam's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Get in the car right this  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah, about to get in, looks at Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call that radio station  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone at work heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just called for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough to call Victoria a  ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a short word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a joke.  Thank God  Victoria doesn't know.  It  would really have hurt her  feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really getting into  it) If she knew, she'd never  forgive me.  It would be  hopeless for the two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open your mouth again.   Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pull back to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Annie and Walter get out of the car, dressed for a  dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you just do a phone  interview?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for the kind of place I  want to do.  I won't be in  Chicago that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get back, I'll be  gone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I'll see you in New  York --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 747 accelerates down the runway and blasts into the  winter sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is looking out the window, preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Foster  welcoming you aboard Flight 132  to Seattle.  Our flying time  today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe that any lie is  a betrayal? That's what Harold  Pinter says, but it seems to me  it's a very harsh way of  drawing the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie turns back to the window, leaving the seatmate,  who in any case doesn't speak English, completely  mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah is standing out of the way at a departure gate,  watching Sam as Victoria checks in for a flight bound  for Minneapolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Jonah) Can I bring something back for  you? A souvenir? (to Sam) Does he like those little snow  scenes? (to Jonah) You know -- you shake them up  and the snow floats down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at Jonah, threateningly.  Be nice or else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely polite) Sure.  I'd really like that.   Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're announcing your  flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, passengers are starting to board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's good at it) He's good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read an article about this ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the same article...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  When I come back,  maybe the two of us should  spend some time together, on  our own.  What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria waves goodbye and starts toward the jetway.   As Sam watches her go, Jonah looks at him, sticks his  finger in his mouth and pretends to gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Jonah, this isn't fair.  You  don't know Victoria.  I hardly  know her myself.  She is, in  fact, a mystery to me.  She  tosses her hair a lot.  Why  does she do this? I have no  idea.  Is it a twitch? Does  she need a haircut? Should she  use barrette so it doesn't  keep falling in her face?  These are things that I'm  willing to get to the bottom  of, and that is why I am dating  her.  That is all I am doing.   I am not marrying her.  Can you  appreciate the difference?  That's what single people do,  they try people on and they see  if they fit.  But nobody fits  perfectly, everyone is an  adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Mom an adjustment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (complete exasperation) I'm never going to meet anyone  who's going to measure up to  your mom in your eyes? What do  you think? There's a perfect  woman walking around out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Annie emerges from the jetway right next  to the one Victoria went into and comes toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a  perf --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sees Annie immediately, and is instantly struck by  her looks, her fluidity, her poise. Annie walks right toward Sam, right past him, inches  from him, not noticing him as she looks for the exit.   Sam continues to stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, referring  to Annie) God, she's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unaware he's talking  about Annie) Victoria? She's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Jonah start toward the exit, Sam trying not to  lose sight of Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I was talking to Jessica  about reincarnation, and she  thinks that probably you knew  Annie in another life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely distracted) Who is Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who wrote us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is preoccupied with Annie.  She takes a turn that he  doesn't expect.  He's having trouble keeping up, because  he has to wait for Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But Jessica says you and Annie  never got together in that  life, and your hearts are like  puzzles with parts out of them  and when you get together the  puzzle's complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lost Annie in the crowd.  She's nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Sam heads off to the exit.  Jonah follows.   As they walk into the distance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I know this and you  don't is that I'm younger and  purer so I'm more in touch with  cosmic forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sincerely hope you are not  going to marry Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shuttle bus drops Annie off at a rental car.  As  she gets in and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. SEATTLE/RENTAL CAR
dialogues.text: Annie driving through the streets of Seattle, referring  continually to a map she has spread out on the passenger  seat, trying to navigate her way to the Baldwin houseboat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie drives slowly down the street, looking for the  Baldwins' marina.  She stops, blocking the driveway to  the marina.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNIE IN HER RENTAL CAR
dialogues.text: checking the map. Suddenly she hears a HORN HONKING behind her.  She looks  into the rear-view mirror and sees Sam and Jonah in  their van, anxious for her to move so they can pull into  their driveway. Recognizing Sam from Wheedle's picture, Annie panics and  speeds away, tires squealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's car is parked just outside the rest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's in the Ladies' Room, splashing some water on her  face.  She towels it off and looks into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (practicing) Hello, Mr.  Baldwin? No.   Hello, Sam? (sweet) I'm Annie Reed. (dignified) I'm Annie Reed. (sultry) I'm Annie Reed. (matter-of-fact) I'm Annie Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She settles on the matter-of-fact reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about you calling Dr.  Fieldstone, and well, I just  happened to be out here on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (businesslike) business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefree) vacation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing confidence,  ready to pack it in) for no good reason at all... (rallying, businesslike  again) business... and I thought I'd  drop and... (breezy) say hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnest) invite you to lunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sexy) take a shower with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed with all  this) shoot myself.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNIE
dialogues.text: watching.  She's at a safe distance, across the street  and down some from the marina entrance.  She watches it  for a moment, then gains courage.  She starts to cross  the street to enter the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie walks toward Sam's houseboat.  Nervously.  Goes up  to the door.  Adjusts herself quickly and knocks.  No  response.  Let down, she's just about to walk away when  she hears a motor REV UP. Annie peeks around the side of Sam's houseboat and spots  Sam and Jonah heading out in their dingy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie races back to her car, jumps in and follows the  boat along the seashore drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we see Annie driving along the water as Sam and Jonah  chug along in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're down at the water's edge, skipping broken  clamshells, like stones, across the surface of the water. They're laughing, pointing, counting out the number of  skips, arguing over the merits of each throw.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNIE
dialogues.text: checking them out from a phone booth next to the Snak Sha

dialogues.speaker: ON SAM AND JONAH
dialogues.text: They're throwing a football.  Jonah catches it and  starts to pretend to score a touchdown, dodging and  feinting.  Sam tackles him and they tumble together on  the beach.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: watching.  The purity and innocence of this little scene  -- a father and son at play -- is affecting her more  than she ever could have imagined.  Their LAUGHTER  filters up to her.  Right to her heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched him play with his son  at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's on the phone with Becky.  We cut back and forth  between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't do it.  How did I  get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky on the phone in bed.  And cut back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told a lie and got on a  plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean. (beat) I'm going back over there  tomorrow and talk to him.  I  am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Good.  Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  That's the weirdest part  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie hangs up the phone.  She turns off the light.   Moonlight coming through the window.  Hold on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie parks across from the marina, starts to get out. Sam's van pulls into a parking space.  Jonah in the  front with Sam.  They're diagonally across a four-lane  street.

dialogues.speaker: ON SAM AND JONAH
dialogues.text: As they start to get groceries out of the car. Annie watching.  This is it.  No chickening out this time She's come three thousand miles, told lies, the whole  thing.  It's now or never. Sam and Jonah start toward the gate to the dock. Annie starts to cross the street, gathering courage and  rightness with every step. But she STOPS DEAD WHEN SHE SEES:

dialogues.speaker: SUZY
dialogues.text: who we remember from eighteen months ago, appearing at  the gate to the marina -- waving, smiling a mile wide --  beckoning Sam and Jonah home like a military wife whose  boys have just come back from the front.  Sam and Jonah  are overjoyed to see her.  Jonah breaks into a run,  nearly leaping into Suzy's waiting arms -- as Sam brings  up the rear, picking up Jonah's sodas which he dropped  when he started running.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANNIE
dialogues.text: She comes to a standstill, in the middle of the street.   In shock.  The scene in front of her is too horrible to  bear.

dialogues.speaker: GATE TO MARINA
dialogues.text: Sam catches up.  Suzy -- no less beautiful and vivacious  than she was before -- tousles Jonah's hair, kisses Sam  and hugs them both. ON SAM, JONAH AND SUZY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it's wonderful to see you.   Where's Greg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's over at the boat show.   He'll be by later. (she looks around) It's so beautiful here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: There is such apparent warmth, and joy, and love about  this homecoming that she forget where she is -- in the  middle of the street.  A car HORN blares at her... all  she can do is stare at the nightmare that has unfolded.   She starts to back away -- and that's when she sees --

dialogues.speaker: A TAXICAB
dialogues.text: coming right at her, horn BLARING, tires SQUEALING.   Annie starts to jump to the other lane but there's a van  bearing down from the opposite direction.  She steps  back to the middle line. The cab goes into a skid.  Annie freezes. Sam heard the noise and turns to see what's going on.   The cab comes SCREECHING right at the CAMERA. Annie screams. The cab stops inches from her body.  The van in the  other oncoming lane fishtails to a stop as well.

dialogues.speaker: ON SAM
dialogues.text: responding.  He runs from the gate toward the near- accident.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CAB DRIVER
dialogues.text: getting out of the cab, as other people gawk from the  sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, what the hell are you  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, still in shock from her brush with disaster,  hears the Cabbie but doesn't respond.  Stunned, she  turns to see Sam on the other side of the street.  Their  eyes meet.  Sam stops, realizing it's the woman he saw  in the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, totally mortified and humiliated by everything  that's happened, bolts for her car. Sam wants to run after her -- but there's traffic is  coming past and he can't cross the street.  Annie gets  into her car, starts and pulls away.  Sam stands there,  deflated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I have been such an  idiot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky's car driving toward Annie's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were standing in the middle  of the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that dream where  you're walking down the street  naked and everyone is looking  at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was nothing compared to  this humiliation, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he saw you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. TOWNHOUSE - ON ANNIE & BECKY - DUSK As Annie leads the way to her door, from Becky's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie takes the mail from the mailbox on her way to the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I could think of to say was  hello.

dialogues.speaker: KERR IS SAYING
dialogues.text: And pull back to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky and Annie looking at the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sign --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sign I've watched this  movie too many times. (beat) I'm so stupid.  From the minute  I listen to that stupid program  on the radio, I've been a  complete jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts absently going through the mail, throwing  almost all of it away without even opening it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know who she was,  Annie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her.  She looked just  like this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows Becky the photo of Victoria and Sam having  dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a photo of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's the same woman.  And  he was crazy about her. (looking at one letter) What is this? (beat) This is from Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the letter. Reads it. Looks up at Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I mailed your letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the letter) "Dear Annie: Thanks for your  letter.  It was great.  We're  very excited about meeting you  in New York on Valentine's Day  and seeing if we are M.F.E.O.  Sleepless in Seattle."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.F.E.O.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cute.  It's like a little  clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie looks at her balefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So he can't write.  Big deal.   I mean, verbal ability is a  highly overrated thing in a  guy, and our pathetic need for  it is what gets us into so much  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with resolve) I'm going to run back to  Walter's arms, if he's still  have me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't mean anything.  It  was written before I went out  there.  Before the ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the letter on an ashtray, takes a match and  lights it.  They both watch it burn.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRE
dialogues.text: And pull back to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire is blazing in the wood-burning stove.  Suzy is  sitting with her husband Greg and Sam.  Jonah is in  evidence, curled up on the couch under some blankets,  asleep.  On the table near the couch is red construction  paper for valentines, doilies, magic markers, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw her in the airport and  then here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to talk to her... (he shrugs) It was like I knew her.  Weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least you're out there  seeing people again.  That's  terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just one really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Jonah taking it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take him a while to come  around.  A month ago he called  one of those radio call-in  shows and told them I needed a  wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charmed) You're kidding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that I'm seeing someone,  it's a whole other thing.

dialogues.speaker: ON JONAH
dialogues.text: he's not asleep after all.  He's been listening all  along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's become obsessed with  some woman who wrote me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to meet me at the top  of the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little derivative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "An Affair To Remember." Did  you ever see it? Cary Grant  and Deborah Kerr.  Before that  it was called "Love Affair With  Irene Dunne And Charles Boyer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women love this movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Jonah, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They met at the Empire State  Building, only they didn't.   Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of person would write  to someone they heard on the  radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got hundreds of letters from  women all over the country --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperate women --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because someone's looking  for a nice guy doesn't make  them desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about rapacious and love- starved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is easier to be killed by a  terrorist --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy's irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Victoria's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you follow her through an  airport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I met somebody.  She's  good, and capable and smart.   We hit it off.  We can't spend  your life chasing after  fantasies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah is devastated by the realization that his dad is  serious about Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to his bedroom opens. Annie walks in.  She's wearing a white men's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (a beat) So far so good.  So.  What  should we talk about? How  insecure we were in high  school.  Shirley Votypka, the  first girl I ever felt up.   Health.  What about health?  Did you know that eating six  macadamia nuts is the  equivalent of eating a steak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unbuttons her shirt. And they kiss. FREEZE FRAME on the kiss.  It becomes the silhouette of  a man and a woman kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouette of a man and a woman kissing on a red box of Valentine's Day chocolates and now we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few quick shot of Valentine's Day in Baltimore: shop  windows lined with candy displays of red satin hearts,  lacy Valentine cards, red roses in elaborate floral  arrangements, old ladies selling chocolates, young  ladies selling perfume. A red Valentine's envelope is being tossed on a desk,  and pull back to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie at work.  She looks at the card and opens it.   It's from Walter.  She smiles.  Looks up.  There's  Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to miss the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. (she starts assembling  her things)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are your plans in New  York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the Rainbow Room  and the symphony tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the symphony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) I hate it. (she stands to go,  starts toward the  elevator) I'm so happy, Becky.  Finally I  feel happy.  This is right.   This is real.  Everything else  is what happens when you watch  too many movies and completely  lose sight of what counts. (as she steps into  elevator) Please don't tell anyone about  what happened.  "Sleepless in  Seattle" is history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie through the train window as the train starts to  move out of the station. MAP OF THE UNITED STATES. The map we saw at the beginning of the movie, as the  light dims in Baltimore and a light goes on in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie steps out of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter opens the door to a beautiful suite.  A bouquet  of flowers sits on the desk.  A bucket of champagne. Annie throws herself into his arms. Walter sneezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pull back to reveal that it's a shot from "An Affair  To Remember." And pull back to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONAH is watching with his little girlfriend JESSICA,  who's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weeping) This is the best movie I've  ever seen in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go to her, Jonah.   You have to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah nods.  But he isn't sure how he's going to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how much it costs  to go to New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows.  It changes  practically every day.  How  much money do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have forty-two.  So that  would definitely cover  taxicabs, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how am I going to get  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm going out for a few  minutes. (sticking her head in  the door to the living  room) Could you keep an eye on things  out front till I get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica looks over at Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is working on the computer.  She punches Jonah's  name into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want an aisle or a  window seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want a fruit plate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I'd rather die than eat on an  airplane. (beat) I'm telling them you're twelve  so you can fly unaccompanied  and they won't make you be  carried around by a stewardess  and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah nods. Now Jessica takes a ticket form out of the desk and  starts to fill it out for Jonah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: formed by two dancers bending over backwards, awash in  pink light and spotlighted in white. Walter and Annie are among a few other people -- couples  mostly -- looking in the windows.  Each one a variation  on the heart motif.  They move to a window -- "Broken  Heart" -- burnished metal, with tow cherubs flying out  of the wound in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: ON WALTER AND ANNIE'S REFLECTION
dialogues.text: in the Broken Heart window. They're both in their own worlds.  Then they both start  to speak at once.  They stop.  Annie looks at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since Christmas, you've  been different.  Kind of  distracted, distant.  But I  feel like you're coming back  from wherever you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. (she smiles at him) I was just... I just got... I  think I got nervous.  It's  normal, right? Don't you ever  feel nervous about, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I did.  And you know what  I think? I think that it was  almost... too perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Annie and Walter walk through the jewelry department  to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started to wonder whether we  were the human equivalent of  two rights making a wrong, you  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter has no idea what she means, but he's completely  good-natured about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Walter are walking around the floor, followed  by a SALESWOMAN who is carrying a large white card on  which she is noting their selections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like kismet but not, if  you see what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's brow furrows slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You have to grow up.  You can't  have all these adolescent  dreams about how exciting your  life is going to be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter starting to look puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't hate me but I love this  pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like my grandmother's  china.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many place settings should  I put down? ANNIE & WALTER Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter beams at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Eight is too few and  twelve is too many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SALESWOMAN writes a "10" on the big sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Annie and Walter come out of the elevator on the  ground floor and WALTER stops for a moment at the  Jewelry Repair department, reappears with a little blue  Tiffany's box he gives to Annie. Annie opens it. Inside is a lovely antique diamond ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my mother's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful.  It's just  what I would have picked out if  I'd had every ring in the world  to choose from. (as she slips the ring  onto her finger) You see what I mean.  There are  people who would like a  relationship to be full of  surprises, but I am not one of  them. (as she starts out the  door with Walter  behind, thinking about  what she has just  said) Surprises are highly overrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they go out the door to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they start down the street and go off into the  distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Promise me something, Walter.   Promise me you will never have  a surprise party for me.  Ever.   You know what happens, you walk  in the door in some horrible  sweater you put on that morning,  and there are hundreds of people  in their best clothes shouting  "Surprise!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's got a suitcase on the bed, packing.  Jonah is  standing in the doorway, watching. He goes to his desk looking for something but can't find  it.  He tries a few drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my wallet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam doesn't remember leaving it in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only going to be away one  night, okay, and Clarise will  be here.  You'll have a swell  time.  You'll watch a little  Geraldo, some Nightmare on Elm  Street 12, I'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah walks out of Sam's bedroom and we hear the door to  his bedroom slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: ON SAM
dialogues.text: Starting to boil. He walks into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And open the door to Jonah's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to have a life.  I have  to do things that I want with  people my own age.  It's none  of your business who I am going  out with.  I don't give a good  goddam if you're angry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up Annie's  letter) This is the one I like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts back to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who you like.   It's who I like.  But the truth  is you're never going to like  anyone because it isn't your  mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam throws a pair of socks into the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Fine.  I won't say anything.   You can marry Count Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jonah.  But the  point is, I am not asking  permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What's wrong with Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphasizing every  word) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah appears at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up?  Shut up???  Mom never  did that.  Mom never said shut  up to me.  Mom never yelled at  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This conversation is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we could go to New  York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't know what I said, but  we're not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing his arms  across his chest) I'm not leaving this room until  you say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, I am sick of this  --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam picks Jonah up and carries him kicking and screaming  into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down.  I hate you, I  hate you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws Jonah on the bed.  Jonah in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick of this phony  melodramatic bullshit.  I'm  sick of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the room and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah weeping as Sam goes back to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of Jonah weeping. Sam sits down on the bed, wiped out.  Hold on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clarise the babysitter arrives at the houseboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Clarise in the hallway outside Jonah's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah?  Clarise is here, okay?  And I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah? (to Clarise) He's probably still asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door gently to the room. Jonah's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks in the bathroom: no Jonah.  In the main cabin. The back deck.  Out onto the docks.  Looking all up and  down.  Clarise coming down the deck -- she's apparently  been looking in the neighborhood.  As she shakes her  head no, Sam goes to the bicycle shed.  Jonah's bike  still there.  Sam stands on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a group of people filing off an airport shuttle  bus.  The sign in front rotates from "Airport" back to  "Marina." Jonah comes down the stairs and steps off with his  Mariners backpack.  He just stands there a beat, looking  around.  Then he goes through the glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TICKET CLERK turns back to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah steps forward, with his ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is sitting defiantly in a chair in the middle of  the living room.  She is being interrogated but she is  not going to talk.  There's a clock on the mantel.  Sam  is in the room with Jessica's mother and father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, this is not  acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't tell us right now,  right this minute, I'm going to  kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica rolls her eyes. She looks over the clock on the mantel.  As it ticks  to 8:30:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the child of travel  agents) United 597.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica's mother and father are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does it leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks over at the clock.  It says 8:31.   Jessica smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Driving to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his car takes the airport exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stewardess bends affectionately over Jonah, ensconced  in the first-class section.  He's got his backpack on  his lap and he's holding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go... here's a nice pin  for you, for flying with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely unmoved,  but polite) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.  Can I take  that for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching it even  tighter) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the reservations desk.  Desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) He's about this high, 90  pounds, never combs his hair,  Mariner's hat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his colleagues) Anyone check in a  unaccompanied minor on the New  York flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill him. (beat) I have to get to New York as  fast as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get you on a flight to  Chicago and you can change  planes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting to punch information into the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you be paying for  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out his wallet) American Express. (there's no American  Express card in his  wallet) Visa. (beat) I really am going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam comes out of the plane from Seattle and dashes  through the concourse, managing to arrive at the plane  for New York at the very last moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jonah comes out of the plane from Seattle and looks  up to see which way to go.  He looks very small.  Big  New York passengers in a hurry whiz by with their  carryons dangerously flying at their sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah stands in a taxi line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah sits down in the back seat.  Looks up.  A big  bruiser of a CAB DRIVER leans back over the seat, sizing  Jonah up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is in an aisle seat.  He closes his eyes and  squeezes them tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Come on... come on... come on...  COMEONCOMEONCOMEONCOMEONCOMEON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks magnificent in the waning afternoon light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are watching from:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Jonah, with his head out the window, regards the  building with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do there,  spit off the top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm gonna meet... (trying to figure out  what to call her) my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Annie walking toward their table with the  MAITRE D'. Annie sits down, looks at the view.  Walter starts to  sit, revealing a spectacular view of the EMPIRE STATE  BUILDING directly behind him.  Annie's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I get you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some champagne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter glances back over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful view, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, there's something I  have to tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam rushes out of the terminal.  Desperate. A cab pulls up.  Sam bolts to the head of the line and  muscles his way into the cab.  The other people in line  are irate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, this is an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls out to a chorus of verbal abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah, carrying his backpack, walks through the majestic  lobby and follows the arrow to the Observation Deck.

dialogues.speaker: DES
dialogues.text: Looking down on the observation deck.  The city below.   The tiny figure of Jonah walks into the middle of the  deck.  Looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's cab speeds across the bridge and into Manhattan,  heading for the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah is going to take the bull by the horns.  He walks  up to a likely-looking WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Jonah.  Are you Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (smiles at him) I'm Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spies another unattached woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, are you Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter shot of Annie talking animatedly to Walter. And pull back to reveal that the Rainbow Room is  actually being seen by Jonah through a viewscope in:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jonah is looking through the viewfinder.  He turns  around, forlorn.  He takes off his backpack and is about  to sit down next to it when Sam bolts into the  observation deck. Jonah leaps into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my family.  You're all  I've got.  What if something  happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's eyes well up.  Jonah starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I couldn't get to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared of what you were  gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I found you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, have I ever done  anything really stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, so far, have I screwed  it up for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them hold each other tight.  After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you flew first  class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all they had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie and Walter.  There's champagne in their glasses,  but neither of them has drunk a drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say about  it, Walter.  It was a form of  temporary insanity.  But I had  to tell you about it because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) -- it was a betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  But it wasn't really.  It  was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  Nothing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the Empire State  Building --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not at the top of the  Empire State Building.  I'm  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. (beat) Look, Annie, I love you.  Let's  leave that out of it.  I don't  want to be someone you're  settling for.  I don't want to  be someone anyone settles for. (beat) I have a life insurance policy,   I'm fully invested in growth  stocks, I have a paid  subscription to Home Rox  Office, I have no sexual  diseases, I have been steadily  employed in a part of the  economy that isn't soft, I have  expectation in the way of  inherited wealth, I dress  nicely, I am a member of the  private sector, an independent  voter, I don't watch Monday  Night Football, the only thing  wrong with me is that I am  allergic to wheat,  strawberries, penicillin,  pollen, nuts and wool.  There  are plenty of women who see me  as the brass ring.  If you  don't -- marriage is hard  enough without bringing such  low expectations into it, isn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is nodding.  She wipes a tear from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Walter.  I don't deserve  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, gingerly, Annie slips the engagement ring off  her finger and hands it to Walter. No bitterness here.  Both of them trying to be gentle  with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Some people will do anything to  get out of going to a symphony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This breaks the tension.  Both of them smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns to look over his shoulder at what Annie  sees:

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE LIGHTS
dialogues.text: A huge pink and white heart. Walter turns back to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Annie's heart leaps and she's about to bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Annie comes out to the street and hails a cab. As it screeches off toward Fifth Ave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are on all over the city. The crowd has thinned out considerably.  Jonah and Sam  are among the last people left.  They gaze out at the  twinkling lights and the ever-darkening sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last call.  Closing time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah looks at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pretty dumb, wasn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll get a dog when we  get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, okay?  Wouldn't you like a dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam puts his arm around him, they start toward the  elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's cab stuck in traffic. As Annie gets out of the cab. She's breaking into a hard run toward the Empire State  Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie sprints in and over to Information Booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma'am, but the elevators  are closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) No.  Please.  I really need to  get up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closing up.  No more runs  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie takes a deep breath.  She's hit the end of the  road.  She turns to go but then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Listen, can I just take a look?  Maybe... maybe... There's  someone I was supposed to  meet... He's probably not  there, but if I don't at least  look I'll always wonder about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Information Booth Person looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary Grant, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my wife's favorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few beat the elevator door opens on a very  empty platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma'am.  Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie slowly walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs.  Heads for the telescopes.  Looks out at the  twinkling lights below. She casually turns the telescope and suddenly sees  something on the floor. Jonah's Seattle Mariners backpack. She picks it up.  She realizes that it might be...  could be... and opens it.  Inside is a toothbrush and  Jonah's teddy bear.  As she takes out the bear the other  elevator DINGS. Annie looks up as Jonah and Sam exit the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left it near the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they stop.  There she is.  There they are.  Sam  can't believe it.  It's the mystery woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one in the street.  I  chased after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Annie too? She smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the  backpack) Is this yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonah walks over to her.  He puts his hand out.  She  shakes it solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jonah. (nodding back to Sam) That's my dad.  His name is  Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jonah.  Sam. (indicating the teddy  bear) And who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods.  Smiling.  Starting to put it all together.   Annie smiles.  Still nervous.  No one knows what to do  next.  Just then, one of the elevator operators CLEARS  HIS THROAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie nods. Sam holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie slips her hand into his.  It feels comfortable,  natural, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Annie. On Sam. On Jonah.  He makes a triumphant little double-fist  gesture to himself as the elevator doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE THE BUILDING from above, all lit up, a romantic  confection, the world's largest Valentine. The CAMERA PULLS BACK and we see the United States  spread out before us, with lights twinkling everywhere. And
